intro: Iguanura polymorpha, commonly known as the red-tailed treefern, is a striking plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, feathery fronds. The plant has a distinctive red-brown coloration on its trunk, which becomes more pronounced with age. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Iguanura polymorpha plays a vital role in its ecosystem by providing habitat and food for various species.
